needs.description: Malaria cases surged to 45,000 in January 2026, with 1,200 severe cases requiring hospitalization. WHO reports 30% of health facilities are non-functional due to fuel shortages and damaged infrastructure.
Cholera outbreak reported in Gumbo and Munuki with 180 confirmed cases and 3 deaths as of 15 Feb 2026. Only 40% of the population has access to safe drinking water.
Over 85,000 internally displaced persons (IDPs) are sheltering in Protection of Civilians (PoC) sites, with overcrowding and inadequate sanitation facilities.
IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) food insecurity affects 1.1 million people in Central Equatoria, with Juba accounting for 40% of the caseload.
needs.funding_gap: Food security cluster 35% funded of $78M needed

needs.description: Malakal PoC site hosts 28,000 IDPs, with recent clashes forcing 3,500 new arrivals since January 2026. Overcrowding has reduced shelter space to 3.2m² per person.
Measles outbreak confirmed with 65 cases reported in Upper Nile State, concentrated in Malakal town. Only 2 of 5 health facilities are operational.
UNMISS documented 12 incidents of gender-based violence in Malakal in January 2026, with limited access to psychosocial support services.

needs.description: Bentiu PoC site shelters 105,000 IDPs, the largest in the country, with acute shortages of clean water and sanitation facilities.
Water trucking capacity covers only 60% of daily needs, with 1 latrine per 95 people, far below SPHERE standards.
IPC Phase 4 (Emergency) food insecurity affects 65,000 people in Unity State, with Bentiu town hosting the majority.

needs.description: IPC Phase 4 (Emergency) conditions affect 45,000 people in Pibor County, with acute malnutrition rates at 22.3% among children under 5.
UNICEF reports 3,200 children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM) admitted for treatment in Pibor, with a 10% increase since December 2025.
Measles vaccination coverage in Pibor is only 58%, contributing to ongoing outbreaks with 120 confirmed cases in early 2026.

needs.description: IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) food insecurity affects 75,000 people in Lakes State, with Rumbek town as the main urban center.
Malaria cases increased to 28,000 in Lakes State in January 2026, with Rumbek hospital reporting 40% bed occupancy.
Only 45% of school-aged children in Lakes State are enrolled, with 12 schools damaged by floods in 2025 still non-operational.

needs.description: IPC Phase 2 (Stressed) food insecurity affects 55,000 people in Western Equatoria, with Yambio town as the main urban center.
UNMISS recorded 8 incidents of inter-communal violence in Western Equatoria in January 2026, displacing 2,400 people temporarily.
School attendance in Western Equatoria is at 68%, below the national average, with Yambio county reporting the lowest rates.
